intro: Kyllinga microcristata, commonly known as the dwarf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of white or greenish flowers. Kyllinga microcristata is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
